info.author: Giles Hall
info.description: With this API, you can read MIDI files from disk, build new MIDI streams, process, or filter preexisting streams, and write your changes back to disk.  If you install this package on a Linux platform with alsalib, you can take advantage of the ALSA kernel sequencer, which provides low latency scheduling of MIDI events.  SWIG is required to compile the ALSA extension sequencer extension.  Although OSX and Windows provide similar sequencer facilities, this API does not yet support them.
info.name: midi
info.summary: Pythonic MIDI API with hardware sequencer support
info.html_description: With this API, you can read MIDI files from disk, build new MIDI streams, process, or filter preexisting streams, and write your changes back to disk. If you install this package on a Linux platform with alsalib, you can take advantage of the ALSA kernel sequencer, which provides low latency scheduling of MIDI events. SWIG is required to compile the ALSA extension sequencer extension. Although OSX and Windows provide similar sequencer facilities, this API does not yet support them.
